content.rendered:
We’ve got Walls (…and walls …and walls) of Books!

Thanks to our trade-in customers, our stores have shelved thousands of books in recent weeks. Remember, when you return books bearing our price sticker, you are guaranteed trade credit of half that price!

We are also happy to consider books from other sources! Your trade credit can be applied for up to 50% of your in-stock used book purchase.

Homeschool – Saxon Math

We currently have an extensive collection of homeschool materials, including Saxon math books. All homeschool inventory is stocked at our Byron and Warner Robins locations and every location accepts homeschool materials in trade.

Sell Your Textbooks for Cash at Gottwals

College textbooks are considered for cash as well as trade credit at your local Gottwals. We buy year-round!

What’s in a Name?

Many authors write under multiple pen names, often crossing into other genres when they do so. Examples include Nora Roberts (known for romance) writing a futuristic crime series as JD Robb and Kathy Hogan Trocheck penning cozy mysteries before writing southern-flavored beach reads as Mary Kay Andrews.

Paranormal romance writer J.R. Ward is also contemporary romance writer Jessica Bird, and Jayne Anne Krentz is also Jayne Castle and Amanda Quick! This is by no means a modern phenomenon. (Benjamin Franklin is known to have published under at least a dozen different pen names!)

Toy of the Week

Dress-Up Lacing Bear: $9.97

Whether dressed for a ball or ready to play ball, this terrific wooden lacing set is lots of fun! Starring an adorable bear to dress and lace, the set includes 17 clothing and accessory pieces, plus two extra-long laces to “tie” it all together. This bear provides a unique and engaging activity that encourages fine motor and creative development.
